thread.title: 'King of Fish' Nathan Outlaw tells the OneDevon Podcast all about his future plans, Dubai and why he's backing fishermen over Brexit deal

author: Richard Amofa
title: 'King of Fish' Nathan Outlaw tells the OneDevon Podcast all about his future plans, Dubai and why he's backing fishermen over Brexit deal
text:
What's On 'King of Fish' Nathan Outlaw tells the OneDevon Podcast all about his future plans, Dubai and why he's backing fishermen over Brexit deal The 'King of Fish' discussed a range of issues, from the recent inclement weather to fishermen and his hopes for the future Share Well-renowned chef Nathan Outlaw is widely regarded as being the 'king of fish' Share     
Nathan Outlaw is a man at the top of his game. 
After working under the likes of Rick Stein and Gary Rhodes, he went on to gain a big reputation in Britain's food industry and is especially renowned for his seafood cookery. What is the OneDevon Podcast? 
The new OneDevon Podcast features everything What’s On in Devon including food, entertainment, culture and much more. 
We’ll be speaking to the people who make our county tick, such as the chefs inside Devon’s best restaurants and the individuals behind the events that everyone’s talking about. 
He previously competed in BBC's Great British Menu, and later returned as a guest judge. What's On editor Richard Amofa spoke with Nathan Outlaw at the Rugby Legends Dinner at Deer Park hotel 
Now known as 'The King of Fish, he now runs his flagship ‘Restaurant Nathan Outlaw’ in Port Isaac, Cornwall, alongside two other restaurants and one pub. Read More
